detailsOfAchievement: The following activities so far done by Project Swarajya: 1- Project Swarajya has started its activities with a campaign programme on Right to Employment in Orissa in the year of 1989. 2- The organisation has pioneered in the field of drug abuse prevention and Anti liquore movement in 1992 when liquor tragedy took place in Cuttack City. As a result the then Chief Minister stopped country liquor during that period. Presently our organisation running two nos of Integrated Rehabilitation Centre for Addicts in Orissa. 3-Our organisation has initiated a campaign to prevent and protect the Olive Redly Sea Turtle, Horse Shoe Crab and Mangrove forest in Orissa Coast. A nos of books. reports have been published by the organisation as well the agencies like Wild Life Institute, NIO including GOI refer that books and reports. In this regard a advocacy work for implementation of a policy to use Trawl Guard (An indigenous device for Turtle conservation) has been done by the organisation. 4- Project Swarajya has intiated a campaign against the trafficking of women and children in Orissa in 2001. Now the organisation is managing a Short Stay Home for distress women. The organisation running two nos of special school for child labour. Besides, the organisation has a good net work in the state. The organisation also serving as the official members of various department of district administration.For detail pl visit the website: www.projectswarajya.coml

address: Puri Urban Leprosy Project, Chakratirtha Road, Dist: Puri-752002, Odisha
title: PURI URBAN LEPROSY PROJECT
detailsOfAchievement: Puri Urban Leprosy project started its work in leprosy control at Puri Town in 1981 in the land of Lord Jagannath. The project started by total sponsorship of Germany Leprosy Relief Association (GLRA), Germany with colaboration of State Govt. Odisha. The project develops its infrasture and personnel to undertake various health oriented programmes in addition to the treatment of leprosy cases. The project has undertaken with different health awareness programme (IEC IPC) for removal of social stigma and multi functional socio-economic rehabilitation programme to bring the patient back to the main stream of society from 31.07.2003 the project involved in RNTCP and working on DMC in Puri town. Sinc 1981 till date 8578 leprosy cases are cured and PR Rate come down to 0.89 by the end of Sept 2012 in comparision to PR Rate 262 at the inseption of MDT. Likewise defermity rate reduced to 0.7 child rate reduced to 5.5 new case detection rate reduced to 17.94. By continious persurance endevour of untiring services of the services of the staff the project stood as one of the best NGO of the district. Its ork was well recognised by Govt. of India and SET Grant has been allowed for the project from 2002-03 onwards.

detailsOfAchievement: SOCIAL ACTIVITIES FOREST AND ENVIRONMENT: As TARABHA village is fully well rounded forest green area, due to deforestation people face a lot of problems. Due to lack of sufficient rain & its water distribution system drought is a common situation. There REACT make an environmental creation program to aware the people. Every year REACT plants a different type of tree in village side area and try to protect the forest from deforestation. GREEN REVOLUTION: REACT started a green revolution among people. Declared every village people are bound to plant minimum two to five tree in the premises. REACT planted different type of decorative tree in the schools compound, village road side etc. EDUCATION PROGRAMME: REACT started a Free Education Program in CHARBHATA village to promote the good academic environment of village. Six to fourteen years children enrolled in this program every year. LITERACY PROGRAMME: Illiteracy should be eradicated forever from every society is the voice of REACT started a Literacy Campaign to eradicate the illiteracy. REACT stared six adult education centre and nine women literacy centre in nearby villages. WOMEN LITERACY PROGRAMS: If mother is literate, country go-ahead, having seen the women illiteracy situation REACT started this above programs. CULTURAL PROGRAMME: TARABHA village is cultural based area where more then five Kirtan Mandalis, Drama Party, Ghumura Parties are performing a good position in the area. REACT organized the Drama Competition, Song and Dance competition in the village in a particular period in the year. HEALTH PROGAMME: Health, Vocational Training is an ongoing activity in our organization. The basic Health objectives of our programs are:  To reduce infant mortality rate:  To reduce maternal mortality rate;  To control population growth;  To educate people about good health and healthy environment;  To achieve these objectives the activities like immunization. GAMES & SPORTS: Every year REACT organized various games like Football, Cricket, Ches match in village level and also organize many game of school college students.

title: Ramhari Das Odissi Gurukul Trust
detailsOfAchievement: Ramhari Das Odissi Gurukul Trust was established in the year-2013 to impart teaching and training in the field of Odissi Music,Odissi mardal and Odissi Dance apart from conducting research, workshops and seminars on these subjects and other allied art forms.The Trust is also meant for the revival, Preservation,Promotion and propagation of the Odishan art,literature and culture mainly the performing arts of odissa. Under the tutelage and guidance of Guru Prof. Ramhari Das , the internationally acclaimed eminent Odossi Singer ,composer and scholar as executive trustee and Guru Dhaneswar Swain as the chairman along with other renowned Gurus and scholars the Ramhari Das odissi Gurukula Trust is committed to the promotion of odissi music ,Odissi Dance and Odissi Mardal and other allied art forms with all its tradition , purity and pristine glory .The Trust organises inter state cultural exchange conducts workshops/training and seminars outside state as collaborative programmes.It provides residential training to the outsiders on different disciplines of performing arts mainly on Odissi Music,Odissi Mardal and Odissi Dance.

title: Ravan Chhaya Natya Sansada odash
detailsOfAchievement: Ravan Chhaya , the shadow puppet theater of Orissa survives only i one village i.e Odash in the district of Angul. The tradition is being maintained by the Ravan Chhaya Natya Sansada Odash which is a registered cultural society and it has devoted itself for the preservation and promotion of the rare act of Orssa . it maintains a full repertory grup of performances and imparts training to youngsters in puppet making, manipulation techniques and music. the repertory group now performance with two sets of puppets, the first which are designed and cut according to the old traditional style and the second with puppets designed and cut on the model of traditional patta painting of Puri.    Besides imparting training , the sansad is also undertaking new productions at lest two productions every year and putting them of all over the state of Orissa cities like New Delhi, Kolkata , Bangalor , Pondicherry , Mumbai, Luckhnow , Bhubaneswar ,Udayapur (Rajasthan) , Dharamastala , Karnataka , where performances have been highly acclaimed.   The sansada has also put up performances abroad in South Korea, Malaysia and Indonesia being sponsored by the Indian Council for cultural relations , New Delhi in 2003. The sansada has been regularly taking part in the National puppet festival in organised by "Sangita Nataka Akademi" , New Dehli, the work shops organised by centre of cultural resources and training New Delhi and the programmes organised by EZCC, Kolkata. The two pioneer gurus of the sansad have been bestowed with central sangeet nataka Academy award for outstanding contribution to the Indian culture specially for the improvement of Ravan chhaya of Orissa. Guru Kathinanda Das has been bested with the central academi award in 1978 and Guru Kolha Chara Sahoo has been bestowed with Orissa Sangeeta Nataka Accademy award in 1997 and the central Sangeet Nataka Academy award in 1999. The sansada has a number of themes for presentation of shadow puppet show.The important themes among them are The Ramayan, Pranaya Ballari, Living in the bad company , tuan and tuin upakhayan , Kanchi Avijana , Karna Badha, Menance of wine addiction and trees plantation .   The sansad has framed courses of suites for imparting training the youngsters. it has created cultural milieu for creative interaction of the artists.  The sansada has not only taken steps to sustain the rare traditional art but also has also created and launched several steps to uplift the folk and tribal art of Orissa.

detailsOfAchievement: RCDC started its journey with the mandate to empower local communities to manage their own natural resources efficiently & effectively for addressing poverty and improving the quality of life. Currently it is working in the areas of Policy and Action Research, Advocacy and Networking, and Field Demonstration, Interventions relating to community based natural resource management and livelihood enhancement. MAIN PROGRAMME AREAS OF RCDC: 1. Research, Advocacy and Campaign on Natural Resource Management. Policy research and advocacy for ge forest protecting and managing communities to own, control and manage forest and its products, land resource management, land alienation & entitlement issues, water resource management, and water use conflicts Strengthening the capacity of forest protecting communities to establish sustainable forest management models and practices. Monitoring & strengthening of participatory forest management initiatives of the government and other agencies. Institution building and networking on forestry and development issues. Research, documentation and advocacy on entitlement over forestland. Independent monitoring and strengthening of implementation of different land entitlement programmes and schemes. Publication of periodicals, communication materials, occasional papers etc. Independent monitoring of implementation of different programmes on water resource development and management. Building capacity of communities and PRIs to establish efficient and effective installation and maintenance of drinking water sources. Demonstration and popularization of cost-effective de-fluoridation technologies. Promotion of specialized education curriculum in the schools for safe drinking water and for water resource conservation 2. Field Demonstration Project - Integrated CommunityDevelopment Programme: Capacity building of different community based institutions/ organisations for resource management and livelihood enhancement. Demonstration and promotion of sustainable resource management models and practices. Promotion of sustainable agricultural practices especially for the smallholders in agriculture. Establishment of community based management of forest, land and water resources. Promotion of NRM based livelihood enterprises and building appropriate linkages with different opportunities in the market. Strengthening capacity of PRIs for promotion of decentralized management of resources and addressing priority development issues of the area. 3. Market Access for Non-Timber Forest Products and Agriculture Produces. Promotion of alternative market frameworks for procurement and trade of NTFP and agriculture produces especially emphasizing a strong role for the SHG Cooperatives in procurement, value addition and trade. Building capacity of SHG especially women SHGs, farmers groups and cooperatives for establishment of community based enterprises on NTFP & agriculture produces. Providing business development services to SHGs, cooperatives and other institutions for promotion of enterprises and building linkages with financial and marketing institutions. Consistent market research and documentation, and providing necessary support to primary producers. Popularization of sustainable harvesting practices especially for NTFP and product standardizations. 4. Consulting Services to CSOs and Development Support Agencies: Technical assistance to NGOs and Support Agencies for developing M&E systems; for carrying out evaluations and subject specific studies. Technical assistance to different agencies for carrying of research work and documentation, Organizing training and other capacity building programmes for NGOs and support agencies.

detailsOfAchievement: Sanjukta Yuba Sangathan (SYS) completing its 24 years of excellence has proved itself as a notable foundation in the state of Odisha itself. Giving focus to the issues like health, women empowerment, education, environment, gender equity, micro finance SYS has reached to the people of every sphere of the society. From its inception it has been working in carrying out with different kinds of government and non-government projects. At present SYS has developed a platform in the name of Shanti Tapoban Ashram which is established in a beautiful natural atmosphere. This stunning atmosphere of Shanti Tapoban Ashram draws its attention to the people from many dimensions. In this campus there are three wings named Matruchhaya (Swadhar Shelter Home), Banaprastha (Old Age Home) and Mahila Talim Pathshala. Matruchhaya since its conception of 2009 has placed itself as a notable foundation for womens empowerment in this district. As the name reflects to mothers shade it has proved to be a stage where the women from difficult circumstances are provided with shelter and are rehabilitated successfully. It has drawn its attention to its beautiful environment where the women are engaged with different kinds of developmental activities. Here they are not only provided with shelter and proper care but also they are given different types of trainings like broom making, candle making, paper bag making, tailoring and teaching related to women empowerment, spiritual and moral values, yoga, pranayam etc. In this atmosphere the necessity of a family life which is the bond of love and affection is also taught to the inmates. There is Amar Hendshel Baer-in regional language (kitchen garden) is developed with the active involvement of the inmates where many kinds of vegetables are cropped according to the season. Matruchhayas contribution to the field of women empowerment is well acknowledged by the government and other agencies located in the district as well in the state. It has reached to the women living in the stage of distress and showed them the appropriate path for their future betterment. At present 47 numbers of inmates with 5 numbers of children are staying in this shelter home. The depressed individuals who are deserted from their so called civilized offspring are looked after with proper care, love and belongingness in the Banaprastha. SYS has formed a platform for the elderly mass named Baristha Nagarik Sangha which is engaged for the welfare of the elderly. Since 2012 the International Elderly Day is celebrated in the campus of Ashram and created a distinguished set up in the state. Mahila Talim Pathshala is a platform where the girls and women from nearby villages as well as from all over the district are given vocational training. Besides it they are also provided with the teaching related to social service, spirituality (Srimad Bhagbat Geeta), promotion of Ayurveda, womens security law etc. SYS seeks support from the private donations to run the Banaprastha (Old Age Home) and Mahila Talim Pathshala. The support from the District Red Cross Society to the Mahila Talim Pathshala is one of the notable views in this regard. There are 10 inmates staying in this home and 20 numbers of students are the part of the Mahila Talim Pathshala. Many programs are held in the natural atmosphere of Shanti Tapoban Ashram with gathering of the people from different facets. The program named Jagruti Divas which is organized here in every Sankranti of the month drag attention of the public from different parts of Odisha state. Besides these 18 numbers of festivals including the national events and regional cultural fests are also part of it. Last but not the least Sanjukta Yuba Sangathan (SYS) requires optimum focus from the civilized mass. It needs support from the government for its better functioning.
